qas.question: What is the cotton harvesting machine that removes the boll with damaging the plant?
What machine strips off the entire head of the cotton plant?
What weather conditions mandate the planting of stripper types of cotton?
What type of plant is cotton?
What is the cotton harvesting machine that removes the bolll and damages the plant?
What machine strips off the chemicals off the cotton plant?
What weather conditions mandate the planting of defoliation types of cotton?
What type of plant is defoliant?

context: Most cotton in the United States, Europe and Australia is harvested <a0_0><b5_0>mechanically<b5_0/><a0_0/>, either by a <a1_0><b6_0>cotton picker<b6_0/><a1_0/>, a machine that removes the cotton from the boll without damaging the cotton plant, or by a <a2_0><b7_0>cotton stripper<b7_0/><a2_0/>, which strips the entire boll off the plant. Cotton strippers are used in regions where it is too <a3_0><b8_0>windy<b8_0/><a3_0/> to grow picker varieties of cotton, and usually after application of a chemical defoliant or the natural defoliation that occurs after a freeze. Cotton is a <a4_0><b9_0>perennial<b9_0/><a4_0/> crop in the tropics, and without defoliation or freezing, the plant will continue to grow.
